Obelia dichotoma
is a well-known species with a nearly cosmopolitan distribution ( Cornelius 1995 ); it is absent from Arctic and Antarctic waters ( Peña Cantero & García Carrascosa 2002 ). In the Southeast Atlantic, it was reported from Angola ( Vervoort 1959 , as
Laomedea ( Obelia ) dichotoma
) and South Africa (Millard 1975). Its bathymetric distribution ranges from the intertidal ( Cornelius 1995 ) to 540 m ( Vervoort 2006 ).
